intro: Lactuca gilletii, commonly known as Gillett's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family, Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, open habitats.
